abstracts.cdata!:
The Education Sector Improvement Project
            for Eritrea will expand access to good quality basic
            education to all children, especially to currently
            marginalized children, improve capacity, and manage
            long-term sector development. The European Commission Trust
            Fund (EC TF) for Eritrea education provides additional
            support to the civil works component of the International
            Development Association (IDA) project and focuses on the
            construction of elementary and middle schools, education
            support facilities as well as skills development centers.
            Implementation of these activities was initially slow but
            has greatly improved since April 2009 with the introduction
            of the community participation rapid results approach
            modality. To date, 320 new elementary classrooms
            (benefitting 18,648 students) and 30 new middle schools
            classrooms (benefitting 2,016 students) have been
            constructed using EC TF funding. Currently, there are
            contracts in place which will allow for the construction of
            60 teacher quarters, the extension of 30 existing and 21 new
            schools and the construction of 10 Pedagogical Resource
            Centers. The extension is necessary to ensure that the EC TF
            remains active.
